title: Teacher Training and Collaborative Learning Programs to Enhance Digital Education Tool Utilization Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Experience with Digital Tools (e.g., Online Learning Platforms, Document Editing Software)
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service teachers and education majors to systematically acquire practical skills in using digital educational tools.

learning_goals: Learners create 2–4 week lesson plans using ≥3 digital educational tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Workspace for Education, Canva) and achieve an average score of ≥4 out of 5 points in peer and instructor evaluation rubrics.
Learners analyze digital tool application cases and propose improvement strategies through collaborative learning with peers

Learners develop a blended learning (online+offline) scenario for one course (16-week basis) using ≥3 digital tools (Google Classroom, Zoom, Kahoot!) within two weeks, and submit an actionable lesson plan (five stages: objectives-tools-activities-assessment-improvement) reflecting peer and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
